Kingdom East Families: WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU!
How can we best meet your needs remotely this fall? Please complete this ONE-question survey by clicking the link here:

https://forms.gle/iy5QrEEdXvbHhwNd7

Due to low staff numbers, including those in key site leadership roles, the Afterschool Program will be offering remote programming for Session 1 for students in grades K-8. Starting in late September, KEAP opportunities will include online enrichment classes, take-home enrichment kits, and phone/online homework help. There will be no in-person KEAP programs at the schools in September or October. We plan to offer in-person programming starting in Session 2 (after Thanksgiving) when we are confident that we have staff members in place to safely manage Covid-19 precautions and safely logistics.

Thoughtful Thursday has come and gone - did you all get a chance to think about your "roses" and "thorns"?

Take a moment to sit and reflect on your remote learning journey thus far. Think about what your roses of the experience are - the positives that have come from this. With every rose are some thorns - what have been the difficult parts of this experience? What has gotten you through those thorny experiences? Although it is much easier to focus on those thorns, it is important to shine light on those beautiful roses that have bloomed from this challenging time. Is there anything in the future that you are looking forward to? If so, let's call those "buds!"

Just remember, there are always roses and buds among those thorns, you just need to look! If you'd like, comment below with a rose, thorn, or bud of your own! 🌹

We take brain breaks at school, and hopefully you are doing the same thing at home! We have all been inside more in the past couple weeks than probably ever before. Getting outside is a great way to give your brain a chance to recharge, while also getting the fresh air our bodies need. The Vitamin D we get from sunlight has been shown to increase brain function and improve our mood. Our bodies still soak up the little sunlight coming through the clouds, so you should still get outside even if it's a cloudy day!

Where did your walk take you today? Did you find anything you've never seen before? Comment below!

#TipTuesday
Influenza, or “the flu,” is a highly contagious viral infection of the respiratory tract (nose, throat and lungs) that can cause secondary complications and attack other target organs in the body. The flu is not just a bad cold! Flu symptoms tend to develop quickly (usually 1 to 4 days after a person is exposed to the flu virus) and are usually more severe than the typical sneezing and congestion associated with the common cold.

Flu symptoms can include:

Fever
Headache
Extreme tiredness
Dry cough
Sore throat
Runny or stuffy nose
Muscle aches
Nausea, vomiting and diarrhea are also common symptoms in children.
